thag6.9:5.1: I was drunk with the pride of birth
thag6.9:6.1: No-one was my equal or my better—
thag6.9:6.3: I was such an arrogant fool,
thag6.9:6.4: stuck up, waving my own flag.
thag6.9:7.1: I never paid homage to anyone:
thag6.9:7.2: not even my mother or father,
thag6.9:7.4: I was stiff with pride, lacking regard for others.
thag6.9:8.1: When I saw the foremost leader,
thag6.9:8.4: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
thag6.9:9.2: and, with a clear and confident heart,
thag6.9:9.3: I bowed down with my head
thag6.9:9.4: to the most excellent of all beings.
thag6.9:10.1: The conceit of superiority and the conceit of inferiority
thag6.9:10.2: have been given up and eradicated.
thag6.9:10.3: The conceit “I am” is cut off,
thag6.9:10.4: and every kind of conceit is destroyed.
